location.zh-cn: 美国马萨诸塞州剑桥市

description.zh-cn: 位于美国马萨诸塞州剑桥市的私立研究型大学，成立于1861年，以其在物理科学和工程学的教育和研究而闻名。
description.en: A private research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts, founded in 1861, renowned for its education and research in the physical sciences and engineering.

description.zh-cn: 美国地质学家、物理学家和教育家，麻省理工学院的创始人。
description.en: American geologist, physicist, and educator, the founder of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

description.zh-cn: 美国律师和政治家，曾任马萨诸塞州州长，他签署了批准麻省理工学院成立的法案。
description.en: American lawyer and politician who served as the Governor of Massachusetts and signed the charter creating MIT.

description.zh-cn: 美国历史上的一场内战，其爆发推迟了麻省理工学院的正式开学。
description.en: A civil war in the United States whose outbreak delayed the opening of MIT.

description.zh-cn: 位于马萨诸塞州剑桥市的私立常春藤盟校研究型大学，曾多次提议与麻省理工学院合并。
description.en: A private Ivy League research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts, which repeatedly proposed merging with MIT.

description.zh-cn: 美国教育家，曾任哈佛大学校长，在任期间曾六次建议将麻省理工学院并入哈佛大学。
description.en: American academic who served as president of Harvard University and, during his tenure, proposed merging MIT with Harvard six times.

description.zh-cn: 美国发明家和企业家，伊士曼柯达公司的创始人，曾向麻省理工学院提供巨额匿名捐款。
description.en: American inventor and entrepreneur who founded the Eastman Kodak Company and provided large anonymous donations to MIT.

description.zh-cn: 美国物理学家，1930年至1948年担任麻省理工学院校长，期间推动了课程改革。
description.en: American physicist who served as President of MIT from 1930 to 1948, during which he pushed for curriculum reform.

description.zh-cn: 美国工程师、发明家和科学管理者，在麻省理工学院担任副校长期间推动了课程改革，并在二战期间领导科学研究与发展部。
description.en: American engineer, inventor, and science administrator who helped reform MIT's curriculum as Vice President and led the Office of Scientific Research and Development during WWII.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性军事冲突，期间麻省理工学院的军事科研活动变得愈发频密。
description.en: A global military conflict during which MIT's military research activities became increasingly frequent.

nodes.id: 麻省理工学院放射实验室

zh-cn: 麻省理工学院放射实验室

description.zh-cn: 于1940年在麻省理工学院成立的微波和雷达研究实验室，对二战的战局有重大影响。
description.en: A microwave and radar research laboratory established at MIT in 1940, which had a significant impact on the outcome of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 一种利用无线电波探测目标的遥感技术，麻省理工学院放射实验室在二战期间对其发展做出了关键贡献。
description.en: A remote sensing technology that uses radio waves to detect objects, whose development was critically advanced by the MIT Radiation Laboratory during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 一场发生于东南亚的战争，引发了美国国内大规模反战运动，并促使麻省理工学院重新审视其军事研究项目。
description.en: A war in Southeast Asia that sparked widespread anti-war protests in the United States, prompting MIT to re-evaluate its military research projects.

description.zh-cn: 由麻省理工学院师生于1969年成立的非营利科学倡导组织，旨在将学校的研究重点从军事转移至环境及社会问题。
description.en: A nonprofit science advocacy organization founded in 1969 by MIT faculty and students, aiming to shift the university's research focus from military applications to environmental and social problems.

description.zh-cn: 英国计算机科学家，万维网的发明者，在麻省理工学院建立了万维网联盟。
description.en: British computer scientist, inventor of the World Wide Web, who founded the World Wide Web Consortium at MIT.

description.zh-cn: 负责制定万维网主要标准的国际标准组织，由蒂姆·伯纳斯-李在麻省理工学院创立。
description.en: The main international standards organization for the World Wide Web, founded at MIT by Tim Berners-Lee.

description.zh-cn: 2013年4月发生于美国波士顿的恐怖袭击事件，其嫌犯在事发三天后射杀了麻省理工学院警卫肖恩·科利尔。
description.en: A terrorist attack in Boston, USA, in April 2013. Three days later, the suspects shot and killed MIT police officer Sean Collier.

description.zh-cn: 麻省理工学院警卫，在波士顿马拉松爆炸案后被嫌犯枪杀。
description.en: An MIT police officer who was shot and killed by the Boston Marathon bombing suspects.

description.zh-cn: 加纳外交家，曾任第七任联合国秘书长，麻省理工学院校友。
description.en: A Ghanaian diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations, and an alumnus of MIT.

description.zh-cn: 美国前宇航员、工程师，曾参与阿波罗11号任务，是第二位踏上月球的人。他拥有麻省理工学院的博士学位。
description.en: American former astronaut and engineer. He was part of the Apollo 11 mission and the second person to walk on the Moon. He holds a doctorate from MIT.

description.zh-cn: 美国物理学家和企业家，因共同发明集成电路而被誉为“硅谷市长”，英特尔公司的联合创始人，麻省理工学院校友。
description.en: American physicist and entrepreneur nicknamed 'the Mayor of Silicon Valley' for co-inventing the integrated circuit. He was a co-founder of Intel Corporation and an alumnus of MIT.

description.zh-cn: 全球最大的半导体芯片制造商之一，由麻省理工学院校友罗伯特·诺伊斯联合创办。
description.en: One of the world's largest semiconductor chip manufacturers, co-founded by MIT alumnus Robert Noyce.

description.zh-cn: 美国音响工程师、企业家，博士音响公司的创始人。他既是麻省理工学院的校友，也曾长期在该校任教。
description.en: American audio engineer and entrepreneur, founder of Bose Corporation. He was an alumnus of MIT and also served as a professor there for many years.

description.zh-cn: 一家以生产高端音响设备闻名的美国制造公司，由麻省理工学院校友及教授Amar Bose创办。
description.en: An American manufacturing company known for high-end audio equipment, founded by MIT alumnus and professor Amar Bose.

description.zh-cn: 美国神经科学家，曾担任麻省理工学院第16任校长，是该校第一位女校长。
description.en: American neuroscientist who served as the 16th president of MIT, becoming the first woman to hold the position.

description.zh-cn: 威廉·巴顿·罗杰斯创立了麻省理工学院，旨在建立一所专注于应用科学与工程的学府，以应对美国日益增长的工业化需求。
description.en: William Barton Rogers founded MIT with the vision of establishing an institution focused on applied science and engineering to address the increasing industrialization of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 时任马萨诸塞州州长约翰·维奇安德鲁签署了成立麻省理工学院法团校董会的法案，正式批准了学校的创立。
description.en: Then-Governor of Massachusetts, John Albion Andrew, signed the act to incorporate the MIT Corporation, formally chartering the institute.

description.zh-cn: 美国内战的爆发使得麻省理工学院的教学工作延误，直到1865年才正式开班。
description.en: The outbreak of the American Civil War delayed MIT's academic activities, with classes not beginning until 1865.

description.zh-cn: 时任哈佛大学校长的查尔斯·艾略特曾六次提议将麻省理工学院并入哈佛大学，但均遭到麻省理工师生及校友的强烈反对，最终该提议被法院否决。
description.en: As president of Harvard University, Charles Eliot proposed merging MIT into Harvard six times, but faced strong opposition from MIT's faculty, students, and alumni. The proposal was ultimately blocked by the courts.

description.zh-cn: 伊士曼柯达公司创始人乔治·伊士曼以匿名方式向麻省理工学院捐赠了价值两千万美元的现金和股票，极大地支持了学校的发展和剑桥新校区的建设。
description.en: George Eastman, founder of Eastman Kodak, anonymously donated $20 million in cash and stock to MIT, significantly supporting the institute's growth and the construction of its new Cambridge campus.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间，麻省理工学院的军事科研活动大幅增加，成立了放射实验室等机构，致力于开发雷达和惯性导航系统等关键技术，这极大地促进了学校的发展。
description.en: During World War II, MIT's military research activities increased significantly. It established institutions like the Radiation Laboratory to develop key technologies such as radar and inertial navigation systems, which greatly spurred the university's growth.

relationships.target: 麻省理工学院放射实验室

description.zh-cn: 1940年，麻省理工学院成立了放射实验室，以支持二战期间的军事科研工作。
description.en: In 1940, MIT founded the Radiation Laboratory to support military research efforts during World War II.

relationships.source: 麻省理工学院放射实验室

description.zh-cn: 在二战期间，麻省理工学院放射实验室协助英国军方发展多腔磁控管雷达技术，对战争产生了重大影响。
description.en: During World War II, the MIT Radiation Laboratory assisted the British military in developing multicavity magnetron radar technology, which had a significant impact on the war.

description.zh-cn: 由于美国国内反战者抗议美方参与越战及麻省理工学院继续进行军事研究，学校最终将部分军事研究项目转移并退出了相关实验室的管理。
description.en: Due to protests by anti-war activists in the U.S. against American involvement in the Vietnam War and MIT's ongoing military research, the university eventually transferred some military research projects and divested from related laboratories.

description.zh-cn: 1994年，万维网发明者蒂姆·伯纳斯-李在麻省理工学院创立了万维网联盟（W3C），以制定网络标准。
description.en: In 1994, Tim Berners-Lee, the inventor of the World Wide Web, founded the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) at MIT to develop web standards.

description.zh-cn: 在波士顿马拉松爆炸案发生三天后，麻省理工学院警卫肖恩·科利尔被嫌犯开枪射杀。
description.en: Three days after the Boston Marathon bombing, MIT police officer Sean Collier was shot and killed by the suspects.

description.zh-cn: 前联合国秘书长科菲·安南是麻省理工学院斯隆管理学院的校友。
description.en: Former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan is an alumnus of the MIT Sloan School of Management.

description.zh-cn: 阿波罗11号登月舱驾驶员巴兹·奥尔德林拥有麻省理工学院的航空航天学博士学位。
description.en: Apollo 11 Lunar Module Pilot Buzz Aldrin holds a Sc.D. in astronautics from MIT.

description.zh-cn: 麻省理工学院校友罗伯特·诺伊斯联合创办了英特尔公司。
description.en: MIT alumnus Robert Noyce co-founded Intel Corporation.

description.zh-cn: 麻省理工学院校友及教授Amar Bose创办了博士音响公司。
description.en: MIT alumnus and professor Amar Bose founded Bose Corporation.

description.zh-cn: 神经科学家苏珊·霍克菲尔德是麻省理工学院的第一位女校长。
description.en: Neuroscientist Susan Hockfield was the first female president of MIT.
